titles.title: Health Care Relief for Military Families Act

To amend title 5, United States Code, to require executive agencies to pay the premiums for health care coverage provided under the Federal Employees Health Benefits program for reservists in the Armed Forces called or ordered to active duty for more than 30 days.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.

bill.summary: 7/11/2005--Introduced. Health Care Relief for Military Families Act - Makes federal executive agencies responsible for paying, for any employee who is a member of a reserve component of the armed forces who is called or ordered to active duty for a period of more than 30 days, for the employee's share of the premium for health care coverage provided under the Federal Employees Health Benefits Program during such period.
